questions.question: What is the definition of the word "irony"?

choices.answer: Ponytail or braid down someone’s back.
Expression of one's meaning by using  language that signifies the opposite
Feeling or idea that a word has, in addition to its literal meaning
The use of humor, exaggeration, or  ridicule to  expose/criticize people

questions.question: What is the definition of the word "lithe"?

choices.answer: Feeling or idea that a word has, in addition to its literal meaning
Influence; spread through; to be present and apparent throughout.
Physical movement that is slow or relaxed.

questions.question: What is the definition of the word "mood"?

choices.answer: The reader's feeling towards a text.
The writer's feelings toward's the text

questions.question: Which of the following words fits this definition: Word’s literal/dictionary meaning
What part of speech is the following word: Cavort
What part of speech is the following word: Pestilence
Which of the following words fits this definition: The use of humor, exaggeration, or ridicule to expose and criticize.
What part of speech is the following word: Tremulous.
What is the definition of the word "connotation"?

choices.answer: Figurative language; descriptions using all five senses.
Feeling or idea that a word has, in addition to its  literal meaning.
The writer's attitude toward or feelings about the  subject matter.
